0.title: SILENT PARTNERS
clues: "Silent Partner", about Mabel Bell, this inventor's wife, reveals that she was one of his deaf students before they wed
CNN called Gen. Tommy Franks a silent partner in Operation Enduring Freedom, the U.S. war mainly in this country
This late night talk show host has been a silent partner with Bobby Rahal on auto racing circuits
In 1972 Leo Fender, known primarily for making these, became a silent partner in a company called Music Man
DAILY DOUBLE

1.title: THE DAY THE MUSIC DIED
clues: April 5, 1994 in Seattle
February 3, 1959, one of 3, in a cornfield in Iowa
July 3, 1971 in a bathtub in Paris
September 13, 1996 in Las Vegas after a shooting
October 4, 1970 at the Landmark Hotel in Hollywood

2.title: IT'S CHINATOWN, JAKE
clues: New York City has 3 Chinatowns: one in Brooklyn, one in Queens & one centered on Canal Street in this borough
You can enter North America's oldest Chinatown at the Dragon Gate at Grant & Bush in this city
This city's original Chinatown in the Limehouse District was destroyed by the Luftwaffe in WWII; a new one sprang up in Soho
The Dr. Sun Yat-sen Garden is one of the highlights of this city's Chinatown, Canada's largest
Washington, D.C.'s Chinatown requires business signs to include Chinese names; this chain's says "Owl Restaurant"

3.title: 15 MINUTES OF FAME
clues: Rick Dyer & Matt Whitton claimed to have killed one of these creatures & showed its body in a freezer
After his wife left him, Ian Usher put his entire life up for sale on this website
After giving birth to 8 babies in 2009, Nadya Suleman got this 7-letter nickname
"America's Most Hated" is a rap song by this man, once the husband of Britney Spears
Ashley Dupre briefly made headlines as the high-priced companion of this governor

4.title: ANGRY MOMS OF FUTURE PRESIDENTS
clues: This boy runs when angry Mom uses this full name & threatens, "Do you want me to get Cousin Teddy's big stick?"
This future 1950s president is scared when Mom uses these three names, especially when followed by "Come here this instant"
The southern lad seen here might not grin when Mom calls him this & says, "Get your hands off that horse"
The 1960s president shudders when Mom uses this full name, followed by, "Turn that chair around right now"
Later caught with his hand figuratively in the cookie jar, he jumps when Mom says, "Get out of there"

5.title: SIMILES
clues: According to an old saying , this beverage should be black as hell, strong as death & sweet as love
Amazement is often said to make these "wide as saucers"
DAILY DOUBLE
This rhyming simile seems to have been a reference to movie star Errol
A speedy person may "run like" this; Patrick Swayze sang, "She's like" this
In "South Pacific" Nellie, unashamed of her cliched feelings, sings, "I'm as" this "as Kansas in August"

6.title: IN THE YEAR 2000
clues: Illinois' governor put a moratorium on these in his state due to questions of justice
The Kuomintang lost the presidency of this country for the first time in 50 years
Willie Fulgear was at the Shrine Auditorium on March 26 in recognition of his finding 52 of these in a dumpster
In France a strike by drivers of these 2-word vehicles left many ATMs empty
On September 6 the pope, like Father Merrin, performed this rite, on a 19-year-old girl

7.title: ACTUAL ITEMS
clues: Seen here, a Brannock device measures you for these
In making pencils the ferrule is the metal ring into which this is inserted
These "tools" strike piano strings
Bottoms up!  A muselet is the wire cage holding this in place
Impress friends in the rec room; this game's throwing line is called an oche

8.title: TRIUMPH
clues: In 2009 Stump the 10-year-old Sussex spaniel became the oldest winner of this Westminster Kennel Club top honor
In 1991 the Pulitzer Prize got "Lost in Yonkers" with this writer
Before hosting "Good Morning America", she triumphed as America's Junior Miss of '63

9.title: IF THEY MATED
clues: The zorse, seen here, is the result of a hookup between a horse & one of these
The geep, seen here, is a hybrid of these two species
Napoleon Dynamite's favorite animal, this cross between a male lion & a female tiger is the world's largest cat
The cama is a cross of these parent animals, done artificially--the size difference is a bit much for nature
Seen here is the first known wild example of a grolar bear, a cross of these species

10.title: RICHTER (NOT ANDY)
clues: Fittingly, seismologist Charles Richter spent almost all his working life in this state
The Richter scale ranks quakes based on how much the ground shakes 60 miles from this
For bigger quakes, the Richter scale has given way to the more accurate one alliteratively called "moment" this
DAILY DOUBLE
earthquake.usgs.gov has a handy primer on the Richter scale: USGS is short for this
(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows a graph on the monitor.)  In seismic data, the maximum displacement of a seismic wave during one oscillation--here, 23 millimeters--is referred to by this term

11.title: CONAN O'BRIEN
clues: In 1993 Conan began taping "Late Night" at this New York center popular at Christmas
Conan becomes the fifth host of "The Tonight Show" after Jay Leno, Johnny Carson, Steve Allen & him
Seen here, he produced Conan's talk show after Conan wrote for him on "Saturday Night Live"
Conan's bandleader, he's also the drummer for Bruuuuce
On Conan's last "Late Night", this "Barney Miller" co-star was released into the wild to be with his own kind
